Treewidth - In graph theory, a tree decomposition is a mapping of a graph into a tree that can be used to speed up solving certain problems on the original graph.
width definition: the horizontal measurement taken at right angles to the length.
In geometry, the minimum distance between two parallel lines, planes, or hyperplanes that enclose a given shape
length - In geometric measurements, length most commonly refers to the longest dimension of an object.
Width has several meanings in mathematics. It may refer to:
Dilworth's theorem, a characterization of width in terms of partitions into chains
In order theory, the size of the largest antichain in a partial order

In graph theory, any of several numerical parameters that measure the sparsity or complexity of a graph
Mean width is one of the "intrinsic volumes" contemplated by Hadwiger's theorem in integral geometry

wiki.text:
In geometric measurements, 'length' is the longest dimension of an
object.<ref>[http://wordnetweb.princeton.edu/perl/webwn?s=length
Princeton.edu]</ref> In other contexts "length" is the measured dimension of an
object. For example it is possible to cut a length of a wire which is shorter
than wire thickness.

Length may be distinguished from height, which is vertical extent, and width or
breadth, which are the distance from side to side, measuring across the object
at right angles to the length. Length is a measure of one dimension, whereas
area is a measure of two dimensions (length squared) and volume is a measure of
three dimensions (length cubed). In most systems of measurement, the unit of
length is a fundamental unit, from which other units are defined.

 length of one kilometre is equivalent to the imperial measurement of
 0.62137 miles.]]
wiki.title: length
